itemDescription: Italian poet and scholar who emigrated to England

wikipedia_page.main:
Gabriele Pasquale Giuseppe Rossetti (28 February 1783 – 24 April 1854) was an Italian nobleman, poet, constitutionalist, scholar, and founder of the secret society Carbonari. 
Rossetti was born in Vasto in the Kingdom of the Two Sicilies. He was Roman Catholic. His support for Italian revolutionary nationalism forced him into political exile in England in 1821.
